revised_title: Initiation of Vinyl Polymerization by Metal Carbonyls
tldr: The authors discovered that metal carbonyls, when combined with organic halogen compounds, can act as active initiators for the free-radical polymerization of vinyl monomers. They studied the polymerization of methyl methacrylate initiated by chromium hexacarbonyl and carbon tetrachloride mixtures, providing insights into the reaction mechanism and kinetics. The results suggest that the polymerization proceeds through free-radical intermediates and offer a kinetic mechanism for initiation.
